abstract: In this paper, we construct linear codes over Z4\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$${\mathbb {Z}}_4$$\end{document} with bounded GC-content. The codes are obtained using a greedy algorithm over Z4\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$${\mathbb {Z}}_4$$\end{document}. Further, upper and lower bounds are derived for the maximum size DNA codes of length n with constant GC-content w and edit distance d.
meta: June 2019Applicable Algebra in Engineering Communication and Computing 30(5)
